title: SR and LR impact of money supply on unemployment

content.question: Assume the banking system has limited reserves and the economy is currently in long-run equilibrium. An increase in the money supply will affect unemployment in the short run and in the long run in which of the following ways?

choices.label: Unemployment will decrease in the short run and decrease in the long run.
Unemployment will increase in the short run and increase in the long run.
Unemployment will not change in the short run and remain at the natural rate of unemployment in the long run.
Unemployment will increase above the natural rate of unemployment in the short run and decrease back to the natural rate of unemployment in the long run.
Unemployment will decrease below the natural rate of unemployment in the short run and increase back to the natural rate of unemployment in the long run.

content.answer: Unemployment will decrease below the natural rate of unemployment in the short run and increase back to the natural rate of unemployment in the long run.
